questions.question: $$\text{A worker suffers a }20\%\text{ cut in wages. He regains his original pay by obtaining a rise of:}$$
$$\text{If } m \text{ men can do a job in } d \text{ days, then the number of days in which } (m+r) \text{ men can do the job is:}$$
$$\text{A boy walks from his home to school at }6\text{ km/h and returns at }2\text{ km/h.} \\ \text{His average speed is:}$$
$$\text{A car travels from } P \text{ to } Q \text{ at }30\text{ km/h and returns at }40\text{ km/h.} \\ \text{Its average speed is nearest to:}$$

$$\text{A man invests Rs. }10{,}000\text{ for a year. Of this, Rs. }4{,}000\text{ is invested at }5\% \\ \text{and Rs. }3{,}500\text{ at }4\%. \text{The rest at }\alpha\% .\newline \text{Total interest is Rs. }500. \text{ Then }\alpha = ?$$
$$\text{Let }x_1,x_2,\dots,x_{100}\text{ be positive integers with }x_i + x_{i+1} = k. \\ \text{If }x_{10}=1,\text{ find }x_1.$$
$$\text{Two trains of equal length }L\text{ travel at speeds }v_1,v_2\text{ (mph)}. \\ \text{They take }T\text{ seconds to cross each other. Find }L\text{ in feet. (1 mile = 5280 ft)}$$
$$\text{A salesman sold two pipes for Rs.12 each. Profit on one was }20\%\text{ and loss on the other }20\%. \\ \text{Overall, he:}$$
$$\text{Digit in the units place of }1! + 2! + 3! + \cdots + 99!$$
$$\text{July 3, 1977 was a Sunday. Then July 3, 1970 was:}$$
$$\text{June 10, 1979 was a Sunday. Then May 10, 1972 was:}$$

$$\text{A man left home at 14{:}30, reached a village at 15{:}15 as per village clock.} \\ \text{Stayed 25 minutes, returned on a route }\tfrac{5}{4}\text{ longer at twice the speed.} \\ \text{Reached home at 16{:}00. Compare the village clock to home clock.}$$
$$\text{If } \frac{a+b}{b+c} = \frac{c+d}{d+a}, \text{ then:}$$
$$\text{10\% voters did not vote; 60 votes blank; winner had 47\% of total voters; gained 308 votes over rival.} \\ \text{Find total voters.}$$
$$\text{A student took 5 papers. Full marks same for each. Marks proportional to }2:3:4:5:6.} \\ \text{He obtained }\tfrac{3}{5}\text{ of total full marks. Number of papers with >50\% marks is:}$$
$$\text{Two contestants run a 3 km race on a circular track of length 300 m. Speeds ratio }4:3.} \\ \text{How often and where does winner pass the other? (Initial start not counted)}$$
$$x,y\text{ positive integers, }x>y. \\ 3x+2y \equiv 2\pmod 5, \quad 2x+3y \equiv 3\pmod 5. \\ \text{Then }(x-y)\bmod 5 = ?$$
$$x+y+z=10,\; x,y,z\in\mathbb{Z}^+. \\ \text{Number of solutions?}$$
$$\text{Clock hands observed from 12:45 pm onward.} \\ \text{When next will they point in the same direction?}$$
$$\text{Packets contain }A,B,C. \\ 5A+3B+7C=24.50; \quad 2A+3B+3C=17.00. \\ \text{Find cost of packet with }16A+9B+23C.$$
$$\text{Which statement about elements/subsets of }\{1,2,\{1,2,3\}\}\text{ is correct?}$$
$$\text{A simplex: whenever }S\text{ is included, all nonempty subsets of }S\text{ included.} \\ \text{Which collection is a simplex?}$$
options: $$\text{All subsets not containing an even number}$$

questions.question: $$S=\{0, \text{all even integers}\}. \\ \text{Which operations keep }S\text{ closed?} \\ \text{[1] addition, [2] subtraction, [3] multiplication, [4] division, [5] arithmetic mean}$$

$$\textbf{(Definition)}\\ \text{For any sets }A,B:\newline A \setminus B = \{x : x \in A \text{ and } x \notin B\} \text{ (set difference)};\\ A \triangle B = (A \setminus B) \cup (B \setminus A) \text{ (symmetric difference).}\\[6pt] \text{If } X = \{1,2,3,4\},\; Y = \{2,3,5,7\},\; Z = \{3,6,8,9\},\; W = \{2,4,8,10\}, \\ \text{then } (X \triangle Y) \triangle (Z \triangle W) \text{ is}$$
$$\text{If } X, Y, Z \text{ are any three sets of numbers, then the set of all numbers belonging}\\ \text{to exactly two of the sets } X, Y, Z \text{ is:}$$
$$\text{For any three sets } P, Q, R, \; s \text{ is an element of } (P \triangle Q) \triangle R \text{ if } s \text{ is in:}$$
options: $$\text{at least one of } P, Q, R, \text{ but not in all three at the same time}$$
$$\text{exactly one of } P, Q, R \text{ or in all three of them}$$
